books.title: The Gulag Archipelago
books.name: The Gulag Archipelago
books.author: Alexandr Solzhenitsyn
books.description: The Gulag Archipelago is Solzhenitsyn's masterwork, a vast canvas of camps, prisons, transit centres and secret police, of informers and spies and interrogators and also of heroism, a Stalinist anti-world at the heart of the Soviet Union where the key to survival lay not in hope but in despair.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.name: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A glorious account of a magnificent adventure, filled with suspense and seasoned with a quiet humor that is irresistible . . . All those, young or old, who love a fine adventurous tale, beautifully told, will take The Hobbit to their hearts

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: international bestseller—that explores the ways in which biology and history have defined us and enhanced our understanding of what it means to be “human.

books.title: Iliad
books.name: Iliad
books.author: Homer
books.description: One of the greatest stories ever told, Iliad has survived for thousands of years because of its insightful portrayal of man and its epic story of war, duty, honor, and revenge.

books.title: Teharje - Krvave Arene
books.name: Teharje - Krvave Arene
books.author: Ivan Korošec
books.description: Pričevanje dogajanja v partizanskem taborišču Teharje o nečloveškem ravanju z vojnimi ujetniki, civilisti in otroci. Odgovorni se niso nikoli opravičili ali sprejeli odgovornost.

books.title: Ukradeno Otroštvo
books.name: Ukradeno Otroštvo
books.author: Ivan Ott
books.description: Zgodovinsko pričevanje povojnega nasilja nad begunci otroki s strani partizanov in komunističnega režima
